lead_paragraph: The report by Amnesty International and Global Witness did not identify the companies fell short, but gave credit to those it said did meet the standards, among them 3M, Tiffany, General Electric, Tesla and Hewlett-Packard.

headline.print_headline: Survey Says Companies Fail to Heed Minerals Rule
headline.main: Survey Says Companies Not Meeting Minerals Rule

snippet: The report by Amnesty International and Global Witness did not identify the companies fell short, but gave credit to those it said did meet the standards, among them 3M, Tiffany, General Electric, Tesla and Hewlett-Packard.
abstract: Amnesty International and Global Witness issue joint report that shows 80 percent of 100 public companies surveyed failed to meet Securities and Exchange Commission so-called conflict minerals disclosure rule; rule was implemented as part of 2010 Dodd-Frank financial overhaul and was meant to determine whether products contain minerals from conflict areas in Africa.
